Grammar: ちゃいけない・じゃいけない
Reading: ちゃいけない / じゃいけない
Example Sentence JP: ここに入っちゃいけない。

Meaning: to be (am, is, are, were, used to)
I think; it seems; probably; right?
Example Sentence EN: It will probably be sunny tomorrow.

Meaning: in; at; on; by; with; via
Example Sentence JP: バスで学校に行きます。
Example Sentence EN: I go to school by bus.

Meaning: I think; it seems; probably; right?
what kind of; what sort of
how; in what way; by what means

Example Sentence EN: I want a piece of candy.

Meaning: there is; to be; is (living things)
Example Sentence EN: There is a dog in the garden.

Meaning: had better; it'd be better to; should~

Reading: じゃない / ではない
Meaning: to not be (am not; is not; are not)

Example Sentence JP: コーヒーかお茶がいいですか？
Example Sentence EN: Would you prefer coffee or tea?

Example Sentence JP: 今日は雨だから出かけません。
Example Sentence EN: It’s raining today, so I won’t go out.

Meaning: the way of doing something; how to do
Example Sentence JP: 漢字の書き方を教えてください。
Example Sentence EN: Please teach me how to write kanji.

Example Sentence JP: 彼は若いけれども経験がある。
私はまだ朝ごはんを食べていません。
Example Sentence EN: I have not eaten breakfast yet.

Meaning: until ~; as far as ~; to (an extent); even ~
would you; do you want to; shall we~
shall I ~; used to offer help to the listener
sentence ending particle; confirmation; admiration, etc
Example Sentence JP: この景色はきれいだなあ。
Example Sentence EN: This scenery is beautiful, isn't it?

Meaning: without doing~ ; To do [B] without doing [A]
Example Sentence JP: 朝ごはんを食べないで学校に行きました。
Example Sentence EN: I went to school without eating breakfast.

Meaning: must do; need to; gotta do
Example Sentence EN: I have to go to bed.

Example Sentence JP: 出発しなくてはいけない。
家を修繕しなくてはならない。
Example Sentence EN: The house is in need of repair.
I want to become a teacher.
It’s a beautiful view, isn’t it?

Meaning: destination particle; in; at; on; to

Example Sentence JP: 友達と映画を見に行く。
Example Sentence EN: I go to watch a movie with my friends.
I'm returning to my home country the year after next.

Example Sentence JP: どうして行かなかったのですか？

Meaning: to be bad at doing something
Example Sentence JP: 彼は名前を覚えるのが下手だ。

Meaning: out of this group, [A] is best
Example Sentence JP: 果物の中でリンゴが一番好きです。
Example Sentence EN: Out of all the fruits, I like apples the most.
I’m tired, so I’ll take a break.
Can I have some water, please?

Meaning: do such things as A and B
Example Sentence JP: 休みの日は本を読んだり、音楽を聞いたりします。
Example Sentence EN: On my days off, I do things like read books and listen to music.
After we ate, we went to sleep.

Meaning: is OK to..; is alright to..; may I..?

Example Sentence EN: What do you intend to do?

Example Sentence JP: 犬は猫より大きいです。
この映画はどうですか。
海より山のほうが好きです。
Example Sentence EN: I like mountains more than the sea.
